intro: Rondeletia belizensis, commonly known as the Belize rondeletia, is a flowering plant native to Central America, particularly Belize. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
